verses.verse: Then I saw another mighty angel come down from heaven. He was wrapped with cloud and a rainbow [was] on his head. His face [was] as if it was the sun and his feet pillars of fire.
He had in his hand a little open book, and he set his right foot on the sea and his left on the earth.
Then he shouted with a loud voice, like a roaring lion. When he had shouted, seven thunders rumbled their voices.
After they had spoken, I was about to write but heard a voice from heaven telling me, "Keep secret those things which the seven thunders said; do not write them."
The angel, which I saw, standing on the sea and earth, lifted his hand up to heaven,
and swore an oath by him who lives forever and ever, who created heaven and the things in it, earth and the things in it, and sea and the things in it, that there should be no more delay.
In the time when the seventh angel blows his trumpet, the secret plan of God would be accomplished, just as he told his servants the prophets.
Then the voice, which I heard from heaven, spoke to me again and said, "Go, take the little book which is open from the hand of the angel who stands on the sea and earth."
So I went to the angel and said to him, "Give me the little book." He said to me, "Take and eat it; it will make your stomach sour, but it will be sweet as honey in your mouth."
I took the little book out of the angel's hand and ate it; it was sweet as honey in my mouth, but as soon as I had eaten it, my stomach was sour.
He then said to me, "You must prophesy again about many peoples, nations, languages, and kings."
